intro: Schizopetalon viride, commonly known as green schizopetalon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a smooth texture. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, which bloom during the warm seasons. Schizopetalon viride is native to tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in plant morphology and ecology.
